Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jl777c> if it is possible to make an fpga/asic resistant algo (that is much more than the whitepaper promised), then and only then would it make sense to fork

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Cruz> @jl777c  I respect your staying true, to the White paper

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jl777c> it isnt my whitepaper, but i think if a CPU advantaged algo can be made, then and only then would it make sense to fork

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <Cruz> What would an FPGA resistant project look like?
100% CPU, no GPU, no ASIC, no FPGA?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Gloryman> @jl777c Well I interpreted the white paper's fair distribution as fair distribution to different types of miners. What do you think fair distribution means in the white paper?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jl777c> well 100% CPU mining has always been a temporary thing

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Cruz> Before Bots take over?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jl777c> but the longer it can be CPU mined effectively, the more distribution it would get

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jl777c> first GPU comes along with open CL or cuda based miners

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jl777c> and now with openCL -> bitstream, the fpga is not far behind

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jl777c> then the ASIC can use the bitstream as a starting point for its design

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jl777c> so it is a process

You sold out and voted with your feet, but still want to steer the conversation?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <Emmanuel> @John Westbrook , we've all been childish or impulsive some times. And we're all on the same boat. 
I remember all the episodes that i've been involved in, all the things that we said to each other ðŸ˜… with some devs, and suddenly we're all working together as komodo notary node operators, because the people, the investors, the whales, the hodlers... believed in us. And that includes Duke - we hadn't a good relationship before the notary node elections, now we have to work together.
You need to understand that we're a very small group of people. Every one is important, even those who are childish or do more mistakes.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <Emmanuel> If everyone stops the comparisons, the accusations, the soul scanning, the labeling... everything settles down on its own. 
As jl777 uses to say - be nice, be tolerant.
